availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Larkin A. Byron (Clay County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmer in Laurel County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Clay County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as 1st Lieutenant and Captain from September 22, 1861 to. Employed Jane Bates as a servant in Clay County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Laurel County, p. 44B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 12.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 210.
